TopicTitle: Where's the preview vids from people like Scott Manley

Articles.Content: Normally they come out like the week before the release, but they have been silent. Why do you think they haven't been allowed to release them?

There's an embargo time to make sure everyone has enough time to record and edit their videos. When the embargo lifts everyone can post their videos at the same time ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Probably because Squad has this whole countdown thing going on and don't want to spoil the surprises
Scott Manley has already announced a "special stream" event this weekend, and it would be foolish to think it's about anything else.
Please don't lift that embargo on the weekend. Do it earlier. Let us get hyped.

> 
> Please don't lift that embargo on the weekend. Do it earlier. Let us get hyped.

They won't lift it till after Squadcast.

> 
> Scott Manley has already announced a "special stream" event this weekend, and it would be foolish to think it's about anything else.

(cheeky)

It's going to be a special live-stream of him getting a fresh shave and buff of his Scottish noggin. I'm sure he'll want to look his best for the big release of Kerbal Snack Tycoon! =p

(/cheeky)

> 
> They won't lift it till after Squadcast.

Why do you think that?
Hopefully there's something of a condensed moisture nature there looking to surprise us with.

> 
> Why do you think that?

Think about it, who would watch Max play 1.0 when they could watch Scott Manley or their favorite you tubers play it?

Why all the rush, its not liek a video will make the game get uploaded any sooner ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif).

Anyways, at least the release is after finals, im so happy it wasnt this week, or much later, as will be fairly free once finals are done and i wont have any major distractions.

> 
> Scott Manley has already announced a "special stream" event this weekend, and it would be foolish to think it's about anything else.

That. He has already done this before, so we should expect about 2h of 1.0 streaming that day.

> 
> They won't lift it till after Squadcast.

I was just thinking this myself.

Just [look back at the .90 release](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/102949-Kerbal-Space-Progam-Beta-Than-Ever-Preview-Videos-Are-Here%21), as a guide. 

They may not lift the embargo until the day before *everyone* can play with it.

Releasing a flood of 1.0 videos any earlier, would be torture ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> Why do you think that?

Historical precedence. The last two media releases were a Saturday immediately following a Squadcast broadcast of the new features. Previous to that they released the media a lot sooner, but I think they decided they didn't like it that way.

> 
> Just [look back at the .90 release](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/102949-Kerbal-Space-Progam-Beta-Than-Ever-Preview-Videos-Are-Here%21), as a guide. 
> They may not lift the embargo until the day before *everyone* can play with it.
> 
> Releasing a flood of 1.0 videos any earlier, would be torture ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Every since the Asteroid update, Squad has been on point with the media releases. Worse thing is create hype, then let it overload for 2 weeks then release the update to an explosive community that wasn't totally positive about getting the game so late.

SQUAD still has a few surprises to unveil during the countdown. Can't have the video folks spoiling it.

-Slashy

> 
> Why all the rush.

Millennials...

So looking forward to some in-depth 1.0 footage ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
